2024.title: Apple Vision Pro release
2024.description: Released Feb–July 2024, this spatial computing headset features dual 4K+ Micro‑OLED displays, M2 + R1 chips, eye- and hand-tracking, and immersive passthrough, marking a major milestone in consumer mixed reality.

2024.title: Meta Quest 3 & Quest 3S launch
2024.description: Meta released Quest 3 in 2024 with mixed reality, pancake lenses, and Snapdragon XR2+ Gen 2 chip; followed by budget Quest 3S (Oct 2024) at $299/$399 price point, widening access to MR tech.

2024.title: Qualcomm Snapdragon XR2+ Gen 2 chip unveiled
2024.description: At CES 2024 Qualcomm detailed the XR2+ Gen 2 platform, delivering up to 4.3K per‑eye displays, 8× AI performance boost, Wi‑Fi 7, 90 Hz refresh, aimed at next‑gen AR/VR headsets.

2024.title: Meta Orion AR prototype revealed
2024.description: At Meta Connect 2024, CEO Zuckerberg unveiled Orion smart glasses prototype featuring hand/eye tracking, wrist nerve-interface control, highlighting next-gen AR vision.

2024.title: Samsung & Google Project Moohan prototype
2024.description: In Dec 2024 Samsung and Google revealed Project Moohan AR glasses prototype powered by Snapdragon XR2+ and Android XR platform, aimed to rival Vision Pro.

2024.title: Industrial AR/VR integrations rise
2024.description: 2024 saw rapid adoption of AR/VR for enterprise use: training simulators (FAA-approved flight sims), industrial metaverse for remote maintenance, spatial collaboration platforms.

2024.title: AR and VR convergence via AI-driven environments
2024.description: AI-enabled VR spaces dynamically adapt to user behavior, while AR/VR convergence boosts immersive hybrid experiences in productivity, training, and entertainment.

2024.title: Smart glasses momentum grows
2024.description: Ray‑Ban Meta smart glasses led consumer smart eyewear in 2024; XREAL Air 2 Ultra offered 154″ virtual screen; market saw growing smart-lens and niche wearable innovations.

2024.title: zSpace Inspire 2 & Imagine laptop debut
2024.description: zSpace launched Inspire 2 AR/VR desktop systems in Dec 2024 and Imagine AR/VR laptop in Jan 2025, targeting K‑12 education with headset-free spatial computing.
